docs.name: Population - Both Sexes / Age 10 / Rural Areas - Andorra
docs.description: The United Nations Demographic Yearbook collects, compiles and disseminates official statistics on a wide range of topics. Data have been collected from national statistical authorities since 1948 through a set of questionnaires dispatched annually by the United Nations Statistics Division to over 230 national statistical offices. The Demographic Yearbook disseminates statistics on population size and composition, births, deaths, marriage and divorce on an annual basis. Demographic Yearbook special topics issues cover a wide range of additional topics including economic activity, educational attainment, household characteristics, housing, ethnicity and language, among others.

docs.source_name: National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (France)

docs.name: Secondary education enrolment Grade 2 (general programmes) / Female - Kyrgyzstan
docs.description: The UIS Data Centre contains indicators and raw data on education, literacy, science, culture and communication. The UIS collects these data from more than 200 countries and international organizations. The UIS is the primary data source of education, literacy and science data for leading publications and databases.

docs.name: Commodity Imports - Edible Vegetables And Certain Roots And Tubers / Aubergines(egg-plants), fresh or chilled - Canada
docs.description: The United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics Database (UN Comtrade) stores more than 1 billion trade data records from 1962. Over 140 reporter countries provide the United Nations Statistics Division with their annual international trade statistics detailed by commodities and partner countries. These data are subsequently transformed into the United Nations Statistics Division standard format with consistent coding and valuation using the UN/OECD CoprA internal processing system.

docs.name: Tourists  : Thousands : Norway
docs.description:
This collection covers national tourism, i.e. domestic and outbound tourism, where "outbound tourism" means residents of a country travelling in another country.
The information on tourism demand, concern trips (for the population aged 15 years and over) of which the main purpose is holidays or business and which involve at least one or more consecutive nights spent away from the usual place of residence (See annex at the bottom of the page).
Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/tour_dem_esms.htm

docs.name: Number of enterprises carrying out cross border trade by type of cross border trade and economic activity  : Number of enterprises : Other computer related activities : Networking with enterprise abroad : Malta
docs.description:
The bus serv collection contains harmonised statistics on business services. The statistics on enterprise turnover by product permits analyses on each product's relative importance in the turnover, consistency of product level statistics and product specialisation. On the other hand, information on enterprise turnover by client enables analyses on type and location of client and client specialisation. The economic variables make it possible to extend the analysis to productivity and personnel cost issues.
The bus serv collection includes the following variables:
number of enterprises 
turnover or gross premium written
number of employees 
personnel costs
value added at factor costs
The turnover variable is broken down by product and type and residence of client. In addition, there is information on the turnover shares of product and client specialised enterprises.
Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/bs_esms.htm

docs.name: Unemployment By Sex, Age And Education, Male, 15-24, Lower Secondary Or Second Stage Of Basic Education - Brazil
docs.description: The unique tripartite structure of the ILO gives an equal voice to workers, employers and governments to ensure that the views of the social partners are closely reflected in labour standards and in shaping policies and programmes. The main aims of the ILO are to promote rights at work, encourage decent employment opportunities, enhance social protection and strengthen dialogue on work-related issues.

docs.source_name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
docs.name: Trade Crops Livestock: Kiwi fruit - Oman
docs.description: The Agricultural Trade domain covers detailed food and agriculture trade data: Export/Import quantity, Export/Import unit value, Export/Import Value, Trade matrix. The Trade module provides comprehensive, comparable and up-to-date annual trade statistics by country, region and economic country groups for about 600 individual food and agriculture commodities since 1961.

sources.description: The United Nations (UN) is an intergovernmental organization established on 24 October 1945 to promote international co-operation.
sources.name: United Nations

sources.description:
Eurostat's mission: to be the leading provider of high quality statistics on Europe. 

Eurostat is the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg. Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions.
sources.name: EuroStat

sources.description: France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (Institut National de la Statistique et des Études Économiques: INSEE) is a Directorate General of the Ministry of the Economy, Finance, and Industry. It is therefore a government agency whose personnel are government employees, although not all belong to the civil service. INSEE operates under government accounting rules: it receives its funding from the State's general budget.
sources.name: National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (France)
